title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-1.4 - Notification to applicant of nonapproval
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-1.4 - Notification to applicant of nonapproval

State Regulations

If the county medical society or the workers'
compensation committee of the county medical society, as the case may be, shall
fail to recommend approval of any such application, whether for authority to
render medical care, or for rerating, or for a medical bureau or laboratory, or
other laboratory or bureau, it shall promptly notify the applicant thereof in
writing. The applicant may, within 30 days from the date such notice was
mailed, appeal in writing to the Medical Appeals Unit. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
326-1.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
